question.title: What is the primary indication for the use of an orthosis?
question.description: An orthosis is a medical device used to support, stabilize, or improve the function of a body part. What is its main purpose?

option_a.title: To improve mobility
option_a.description: An orthosis can help improve mobility by providing support and stability to joints or body parts.

option_b.title: To immobilize a joint
option_b.description: Orthoses can be used to immobilize a joint to allow it to heal or to reduce pain and inflammation.

option_c.title: To improve function
option_c.description: Orthoses can be used to improve function by providing support and stability to joints or body parts.

option_d.title: To treat a specific disease or condition
option_d.description: Orthoses can be used to treat a variety of medical conditions, such as arthritis or spinal deformities.

correct_option.title: Improve function
correct_option.description: The correct answer is 'Improve function'. Orthoses can be used to improve function by providing support and stability to joints or body parts.
